intro: Melandrium ruinarum, commonly known as the rock melandrium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and pinks. This species is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as cliffs or disturbed ground. It is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
